member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier
member.summary: Encapsulates a grid parser that can parse and verify a string value and convert it into a valid grid instance.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.ParseFunctions
member.summary: The list of all methods to parse.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.MultilineParseFunctions
member.summary: The list of all methods to parse multiple-line grid.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance with parsing data.

summary.para: Indicates the constructor of the current type.
This constructor will initialize some data members of this type that can't use a simple expression to describe the initial value.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.ParsingValue
member.summary: The string value to parse.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.CompatibleFirst
member.summary: Indicates whether the parser will change the execution order of PM grid. If the value is , the parser will check compatible one first, and then check recommended parsing plan ('<d>' and '*d*').

member.name: P:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.ShortenSusserFormat
member.summary: Indicates whether the parser will use shorten mode to parse a susser format grid. If the value is , the parser will omit the continuous empty notation .s or 0s to a *.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.Parse
member.summary: To parse the value.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingSimpleMultilineGrid(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@)
member.summary: Parse the value using multi-line simple grid (without any candidates).

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingExcel(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@)
member.summary: Parse the Excel format.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingOpenSudoku(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@)
member.summary: Parse the open sudoku format grid.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingPencilMarked(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@)
member.summary: Parse the PM grid.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingSimpleTable(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@)
member.summary: Parse the simple table format string (Sudoku explainer format).

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingSusser(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parse the susser format string.
member.param: Indicates whether the parser will shorten the susser format.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier.OnParsingSukaku(Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers.SimpleGridCodeVerifier@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parse the sukaku format string.
member.param: Indicates whether the algorithm uses compatibility mode to check and parse sudoku grid.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors
member.summary: Represents with the well-known diagnostic descriptors.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0001
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0001:
Title: Special type missing
Description: Special type is missing; please check the code analysis project and change the namespace.
Category: CodeAnalysis
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0101
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0101:
Title: Don't initialize large structure
Description: Don't initialize large structure; please use expected fields or 'Create' methods instead if available.
Category: Usage
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0102
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0102:
Title: Large structures should pass by reference
Description: Large structure should pass by reference in order to optimize performance.
Category: Performance
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0106
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0106:
Title: Specified field cannot be invoked
Description: Specified field of function pointer type cannot be invoked.
Category: Usage
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0107
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0107:
Title: Specified field is not function pointer type
Description: Specified field marked 'DisallowFunctionPointerInvocationAttribute' is not function pointer type.
Category: Usage
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0109
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0109:
Title: Specified field can only be accessed in a same file
Description: Specified field can only be accessed in a same file where the field is declared.
Category: Design
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0110
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0110:
Title: Specified field cannot be private
Description: Specified field marked 'FileAccessOnlyAttribute' cannot be private.
Category: Design
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0111
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0111:
Title: Specified constructor can only be accessed in a same file
Description: Specified constructor can only be accessed in a same file where the constructor is declared.
Category: Design
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0112
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0112:
Title: There's no need to apply 'FileAccessOnlyAttribute' on members whose containing type has already been a file local type
Description: There's no need to apply 'FileAccessOnlyAttribute' on members whose containing type has already been a file local type.
Category: Design
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0113
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0113:
Title: Missing 'SelfAttribute'

Category: Usage
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0114
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0114:

Category: Usage
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0115
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0115:
Title: Self type parameter should be named 'TSelf'
Description: Self type parameter should be named 'TSelf'.
Category: Naming
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0201
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0201:
Title: Use type 'Argument' instead
Description: The current 'if' statement can be converted into 'Argument' method invocation; use 'Argument' instead to simplify the code.
Category: Usage
Severity:

member.name: F:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownDiagnosticDescriptors.SCA0202
member.summary:
Indicates the diagnostic result SCA0202:

member.name: T:System.StringExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods on .

member.name: F:System.StringExtensions.MatchingTimeSpan
member.summary: Indicates the time span that is used for matching.

member.name: F:System.StringExtensions.InvalidOperation
member.summary: Indicates the exception that will be thrown when a certain regular expression is invalid.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.CountOf(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Count how many specified characters are in the current string.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.SatisfyPattern(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check whether the specified string instance is satisfied the specified regular expression pattern or not.
member.param: The regular expression pattern. If the value is , the return value is always .
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not a valid regular expression pattern.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.IsMatch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check whether the specified string instance can match the value using the specified regular expression pattern or not.
member.remarks: This method is a syntactic sugar of the calling method .
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not a valid regular expression pattern.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.ReplaceAt(System.String,System.Int32,System.Char)
member.summary: Replace the character at the specified index with the new value.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.RemoveAll(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Removes all specified characters.
member.param: The character to be removed from the base string.
member.returns: The result string value after removal.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.Match(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Searches the specified input string for the first occurrence of the specified regular expression pattern.
member.returns: The value after matching. If failed to match, the value will be .
member.remarks: This method is a syntactic sugar of the calling method .
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not a valid regular expression pattern.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.Match(System.String,System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions)
member.summary: Searches the input string for the first occurrence of the specified regular expression, using the specified matching options.
member.returns: The matched string value. If failed to match, the value will be .
member.remarks: This method is a syntactic sugar of the calling method .
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not a valid regular expression pattern.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.MatchAll(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Searches the specified input string for all occurrences of a specified regular expression pattern.
member.returns: The result after matching. If failed to match, the returning array will be an empty string array (has no elements).
member.remarks: This method is a syntactic sugar of the calling method .
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not a valid regular expression pattern.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.MatchAll(System.String,System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions)
member.summary: Searches the specified input string for all occurrences of a specified regular expression pattern, using the specified matching options.
member.returns: The result after matching. If failed to match, the returning array will be an empty string array (has no elements).
member.remarks: This method is a syntactic sugar of the calling method .
member.exception: Throws when the specified is not a valid regular expression pattern.

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.Reserve(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reserve all characters that satisfy the specified pattern.
member.param:
The pattern that reserved characters satisfied. All supported patterns are:
@"\d" To match a digit.
@"\t" To match a tab.
@"\w" To match a letter, digit or underscore character '_'.
member.remarks: For example, if code is "Hello, world!".Reserve(@"\w"), the return value will only contain the letters, digits or the underscore character '_' (i.e. "Helloworld" as the result of this example).
member.exception: Throws when the is invalid. All possible patterns are shown in the tip for the parameter .

member.name: M:System.StringExtensions.IsRegexPattern(System.String)
member.summary: To check if the current string value is a valid regular expression pattern or not.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Range.EndAt(System.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element in the collection to the end Index.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.
